Package cpsc2150.extendedConnectX.models

Class GameBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • cpsc2150.extendedConnectX.models.AbsGameBoard
      • cpsc2150.extendedConnectX.models.GameBoard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IGameBoard
    public class GameBoard
extends AbsGameBoard
implements IGameBoard
    This class determines what characters are at certain positions and places tokens into the board using a 2D array for run speed.
    Invariant:
    0 <= row < MAX_NUM_ROWS AND 0 <= column <= MAX_NUM_COLUMNS, No tokens can be placed in a full column, No tokens can be placed outside of the board, No gaps between non-space positions
    Correspondence:
    minRow <= ROW <= maxRow, minColumn <= COLUMN <= maxColumn, minWin <= WIN <= maxWin, self = board[0...maxRow][0...maxColumn]
    Section:
    CPSC 2151 007

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface cpsc2150.extendedConnectX.models.IGameBoard

        maxColumn, maxPlayer, maxRow, maxWin, minColumn, minPlayer, minRow, minWin

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      GameBoard​(int r, int c, int w)
      Creates a 2-dimensional array of characters where position [0][0] would be the bottom left of the board and [ROW - 1][COLUMN - 1] would be the top right of the board; all with blank characters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameBoard

        public GameBoard​(int r,
                 int c,
                 int w)
        Creates a 2-dimensional array of characters where position [0][0] would be the bottom left of the board and [ROW - 1][COLUMN - 1] would be the top right of the board; all with blank characters.
        Parameters:
        r - The number of rows the board will have
        c - The number of columns the board will have
        w - The number of tokens in a row needed to win
        Post:
        [board[ROW][COLUMN] is created with empty characters] AND ROW = r, COLUMN = c, WIN = w

    • Method Detail

      • whatsAtPos

        public char whatsAtPos​(BoardPosition pos)
        Returns what is in the GameBoard at position pos . If no marker is there, it returns a blank space char.
        Specified by:
        whatsAtPos in interface IGameBoard
        Parameters:
        pos - The BoardPosition coordinate to be checked
        Pre:
        0, 0 <= pos <= ROW - 1, COLUMN - 1
        Post:
        [The token that is at pos is returned, ' ' if there isn't a token there]
        Returns:
        The character at position pos or ' ' if there is nothing there

      • placeToken

        public void placeToken​(char p,
                       int c)
        Places the character p in column c. The token will be placed in the lowest available row in column c.
        Specified by:
        placeToken in interface IGameBoard
        Parameters:
        p - The character token
        c - The column that the token will be placed in
        Pre:
        GameBoard instance exists and checkIfFree returns true for a specified column
        Post:
        A valid token is placed in the lowest available row of the column
